title: 114_hr4302
content:
The Secretary is responsible for resolving and terminating all functions of the Bank as outlined in the Act. Functions transferred to the Secretary will end once all obligations are satisfied. The Secretary must report this determination to Congress. The Secretary of the Treasury is responsible for implementing the Act, including the administration and dissolution of functions transferred to them, handling outstanding obligations of the Federal Government from terminated programs, and taking necessary actions to dissolve any remaining affairs of the Bank. The Secretary can delegate functions to wind up transferred responsibilities, and no positions or functions of the Bank are authorized after 60 days of abolishment. Conforming amendments and repeals are also addressed in the Act. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts. The Export-Import Bank Act of 1945 and related authorizing provisions are repealed, including sections from various Acts such as Public Law 90-390, the Trade and Development Enhancement Act of 1983, the Foreign Operations, Export Financing, and Related Programs Appropriations Act of 1990, the Omnibus Trade and Competitiveness Act of 1988, and title 31 of the United States Code. (c) Elimination of Related Compensation Provisions:
- Section 5314 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to remove the position of "President of the Export-Import Bank of Washington."
- Section 5315 of title 5, United States Code, is amended to remove the positions of "First Vice President of the Export-Import Bank of Washington" and "Members, Board of Directors of the Export-Import Bank of Washington."

(d) Elimination of Office of Inspector General for the Bank:
- Amendments are made to the Inspector General Act of 1978 to remove references to the President of the Export-Import Bank and the Export-Import Bank itself.

(e) Effective Date:
- The repeals and amendments made by this section will take effect on the abolishment date.

(f) Report to the Congress on Other Amendments to Federal Statute:
- The Secretary will submit a report to the relevant Committees on additional amendments to federal statutes. The Secretary will submit a report to Congress with suggestions for amendments to Federal statutes as necessary due to this Act. SEC. 10. REFERENCES. Any reference in Federal law, executive orders, rules, regulations, or documents to a department or office affected by this Act will now refer to the new department or office. SEC. 11. DEFINITIONS. "Function" includes duties, powers, and programs, while "office" encompasses various organizational entities.
